programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell fights off competition as he tries to secure a locker worth $27,000, and Dave bids for a unit with a stockpile of antiques.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: American Jewelry celebrates its 30th anniversary, and Les wants to put on a big celebration He assigns Seth and Ashley five days to plan it, but they clash over their ideas.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A sloppy mistake puts the Golds' business in jeopardy, and a dispute on the shop floor gets out of hand.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Rick and Marty make an extraordinary discovery in the island's surrounding waters.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The teams search for an edge on their prey, with one group using a primitive alternative to the modern hook, while another decides to use alligator meat as bait.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of the Jamie Davis Heavy Rescue team that patrols the Coquihalla Highway on Canada's Cascade Mountains.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An original sketch from a popular animation is brought into the shop, and Rick is offered what is believed to be a first edition of Richard Nixon's memoir.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Original artwork from the 1995 Batman-Spider-Man crossover comic shows up in the shop. Plus, Rick examines a deadly Revolutionary War halberd.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les shocks the others when he reveals his plans to buy a new store. Meanwhile, a man wanting to pawn his VCR causes a scene, and another tries to get money for his fake eye.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les goes into detail about his plans for a new pawn store, and Ashley is caught in the crossfire when a fight breaks out in the middle of the floor.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams search for the most profitable spare parts of quirky vehicles, including campervans and VW Beetles. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While preparing to send another dive team to explore 10-X, Rick and Marty examine claims that Christopher Columbus can be linked to the Oak Island mystery.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: Experts examine the concept of crop circles, investigating whether these odd patterns could be a message from another world or just an elaborate hoax.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigating whether spiritual leaders known as shamans, who have healed and protected people throughout history really have contact with extraterrestrial realms.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is spellbound when a book signed by the great Harry Houdini appears in the shop. Meanwhile, Corey spots an old X-ray unit and Chum takes a vow of silence.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A prop from the movie Cleopatra and a 1922 silver peace dollar make for an interesting day at the Gold and Silver pawn shop.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave comes to blows with his estranged brother over rock memorabilia, and Barry discovers a valuable piece of modern art.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A mystery bidder begins to dominate the competition, pushing Dave to the limit.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: At the new shop, the Golds are surprised to find a bag of gems inside a former employee's desk.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds have a decision to make when a man wants to buy a pair of very expensive earrings on the condition that the store also does his piercing.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams search for the most profitable spare parts of quirky vehicles, including campervans and VW Beetles. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The Hudson Valley area of upstate New York, where more than 7,000 UFO sightings have been reported. This edition speculates whether the area is home to one of the many extra-terrestrial gateways that are believed to be spread all over the world.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate stories of a French church that supposedly contains a gateway to another universe and an alien library believed to be hidden underneath the Great Sphinx of Giza.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While preparing to send another dive team to explore 10-X, Rick and Marty examine claims that Christopher Columbus can be linked to the Oak Island mystery.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Paul tries to persuade his son that they should purchase lockers with an odd number after a lucky poker win, and Ursula buddies up with her pet chinchilla.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: A secret stash of military goods promised to cause Cindy and Rick's profits to blow up in a bidding war. Plus, Mike and Armando put the competition on ice.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Steve takes on the challenge of restoring a rusty 1978 Gran Torino to its former glory.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.sub-title: Two Men And A Fake Baby
programme.desc: Bogart's wife tests his parenting skills by challenging him to look after a fake baby while attending an auction in Mississauga.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.sub-title: The Birds and the Bees and the Bulls
programme.desc: The buyers head to Roy's hometown of Keswick for an auction. Meanwhile, Paul and Bogart try to utilise the advice of their life coach.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave has his eye on an electronics locker, and Darrell uncovers a classic movie prop.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry asks a member of rock band Aerosmith for a valuation, and Dave discovers an antique toy.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The creation of a set of Second World War sea defences built near the mouth of the River Thames to protect London. Plus, a concrete pyramid build during the Cold War.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: Hitler's plans to invade the US using battleships, long-range bombers and secret infiltrators. Plus, a look at support for the Nazi movement in America during the 1940s.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Heinrich Himmler, the book-loving loner whose strange mystical beliefs drove him to carry out the most shocking act of genocide in human history.

programme.title: Waterloo Dead
programme.desc: Two hundred years after the Battle of Waterloo, investigators Tim Sutherland, Malin Holst and Simon Richardson employ forensic techniques to uncover surprising secrets from one of the greatest military encounters of all time.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: Documentary about the Holocaust and some of the key figures involved, beginning with Hjalmar Schacht, who was never a Nazi but played a vital role in Hitler's plans.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of the Vajont Dam in the mountains of northern Italy, and the catastrophic flood in 1963 that caused the deaths of 2000 people.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.sub-title: John Christie: Serial Killer - Part Two
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part profile of John Christie, looking at how his crimes were blamed on an innocent man, who was sentenced to death.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Heinrich Himmler, the book-loving loner whose strange mystical beliefs drove him to carry out the most shocking act of genocide in human history.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Bowood House in Wiltshire. Among the items being brought in for valuation are a collection of glass ornaments, an 18th-century portrait that children have used for target practice, a carved walking stick, a book documenting the travels of a 19th-century explorer and an account of the sinking of the Titanic by an officer who survived.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three rare Alvises get the auction buyers going when put under the hammer. A Chevy Corvette which started its journey in Saudi Arabia makes its way to Thornton le Dale for the sale.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Welshpool, Powys, to Aberystwyth in Ceredigion. He experiences Victorian entertainment in one of Wales's best-loved resorts, hears how the railways took the country's textiles into the most exclusive households and unleashes the power of a 19th-century engineering triumph.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the next stage of his journey in which he travels from the naval hub of Portsmouth to Grimsby docks. On the first leg, he helps feed the crew of Britain's newest battleship, discovers how the Victorians planned to repel a possible French invasion and learns there is a well-established industry in an unlikely location.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second of two programmes from Bowood House, Wiltshire, and hears the story of a man who went in search of his biological father after finding letters to his mother from an American soldier. The experts examine a box engraved with a secret code, a cigarette case made by a Russian craftsman, a collection of transistor radios and a cartoon based on a news story about an escaped lion that hid in a school.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes some of the varied species to be found in tropical rainforests, from the amusing courtship rituals of the birds of paradise and a chimpanzee group defending its territory to a flying-frog mating orgy and the sinister parasitic fungi cordyceps, which eat their victims alive.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave gets a nasty surprise when he opens the bonnet of a fast Ford from the 80's, and an Austin Heavy 12 nearly a century old sets off a bidding war at the auction.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of the Vajont Dam in the mountains of northern Italy, and the catastrophic flood in 1963 that caused the deaths of 2000 people.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: Hitler's vision of the ideal citizen of the Third Reich, using breeding programmes and special schools to promote Aryan racial traits and complete devotion to his regime.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Albert Speer, the apolitical architect whose desire to build grand buildings led him to sell his soul.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Woking in Surrey to Clapham Junction in south London. Along the way he gets close to some precious Victorian botany at Kew Gardens, tries his hand at croquet and discovers a very surprising 19th-century place of worship.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Victoria station to Abbey Wood in south-east London. Along the way he learns how volunteer Victorian firefighters liked a tipple, discovers that 19th-century sewage pumps were a marvel of design and puts in a shift at the oldest fish market in Britain.

programme.title: David Jason: My Life on Screen
programme.desc: The actor remembers the people and places that inspired his later roles, including A Touch of Frost.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber is feeling dejected after his romantic fortunes take a turn for the worse, so Fletch tries to revive his friend's flagging spirits. However, his cunning plan has one potential drawback - it involves his own daughter. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Leo and Harry's professional rivalry erupts following Sam's departure. They deal with the case of several children who experienced unexplained breathing difficulties, leaving one of them dead. While Harry believes this was mass hysteria, Leo suspects something more sinister. Meanwhile, a man is found dead in his car with a stab wound to the chest. Tom Ward and William Gaminara star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An armed robbery case leads Phil Hunter and Jo Masters to the door of petty criminal Gareth Dickson, who is making and selling firearms so shoddy they are a danger to the user - as his eight-year-old nephew seems keen to prove. Gina Gold gets a warm welcome back at Sun Hill, but for Sheelagh Murphy the return to work following the death of fiance David Kent brings a crisis of confidence and a confession she's thinking of resigning.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch rescue a man trapped in an industrial chimney trying to rescue a cat, and avert tragedy when a caravan collapses.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Jeremy announces he is planning to marry his girlfriend, but is surprised at his friends' response. Meanwhile, Cate Hobbs receives bad news.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Lilian receives a visitor from beyond the grave while honeymooning with Jeremy, while Deborah's dalliance with drugs leads to her spending the eve of her wedding in prison. A truck carrying men and weapons to Aldershot is ambushed by hooded mercenaries and Chris' intervention leads to him being shot and taken hostage.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An armed robbery case leads Phil Hunter and Jo Masters to the door of petty criminal Gareth Dickson, who is making and selling firearms so shoddy they are a danger to the user - as his eight-year-old nephew seems keen to prove. Gina Gold gets a warm welcome back at Sun Hill, but for Sheelagh Murphy the return to work following the death of fiance David Kent brings a crisis of confidence and a confession she's thinking of resigning.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Leanne's dad Steve tells Lola he is ready to have his baby back but she refuses to believe he is off drugs and demands that he be tested. Meanwhile, Matt gets cold feet when questioned about his relationship with Nikki, and Elliot continues to come to terms with Gina's death. Medical drama, with Paul Bradley.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A local politician risks her career when her illicit lover is trapped inside a hotel after an explosion. As Charlie and Max attempt to rescue the injured man from the rubble, the miscreant MP deliberates whether she should take Charlie's advice to follow her heart and spend what could be his last moments with him. With a guest appearance by Star Trek: The Next Generation's Marina Sirtis.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sheelagh Murphy announces she's transferring to the Child Protection Unit at Croydon and Roger Valentine has temptation put in his way by bent copper Harry Haynes, the man he's investigating. As the coroner's hearing into the death of David Kent approaches, June Ackland nervously prepares to meet her long-lost son Gabriel, and a barrage of questions about his father forces her to reveal the circumstances under which she became pregnant.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Robbie's actions come home to roost. Insurance investigations of the car lot fire drives Frank into action. Grant lies to Sharon about Dougie. Phil checks out a face from the past.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant discovers Dougie has altered the arrangements for the supermart robbery. Sharon increases pressure on Grant. Phil tries to help Kathy to come to terms with the past.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A short circuit causes havoc at a children's party, and Blue Watch have to save a man hanging over an electrical transformer. Starring Andrew Kazamia.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack is shocked and angry when Beth is assaulted by a patient's father. Drama, starring Amanda Burton, Sam Shepherd and Kevin Whately.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Simon Goddard's return from Australia worries the locals, but the former factory owner declares he is only visiting his daughter Amy. Kim enjoys the company of Alistair and his family, leaving Danny green with envy. Joe and Alice prepare to come clean about their relationship - until a bad-tempered Harding makes them change their mind.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey tries to help ex-con Desmond, but Sharon is convinced he is a lost cause - and she is soon proved right. Linda Robson and Pauline Quirke star.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey takes a holiday, but frets about leaving her beloved Grantleigh Manor in DeVere's hands. Penelope Keith stars.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: When the Teesdales stop to give Clegg, Compo and Seymour a lift home from their caravanning holiday, Mrs T tries to fight off a feeling of discomfort as it becomes apparent the trio are determined to help park the caravan in their drive. Peter Sallis stars.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg makes himself scarce after learning Nora, Ivy and Edie want to pair him up with a timid woman who he once knew at school. Peter Sallis stars.

programme.title: Inspector Alleyn Mysteries
programme.desc: An investigation gets under way when barrister Luke Watchman dies of cyanide poisoning during his annual holiday at an inn. Crime drama, starring Patrick Malahide, Kevin McNally and William Simons.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Back in 1983, 16-year-old Amy Taskerland was murdered on the night of the school disco. More than 30 years later, the unearthing of a time capsule and the discovery of her voice on a mix tape inside prompts Miller and co to delve back into the case, starting by interviewing Amy's best friend Harriet and her former teacher Mr Hines. The recording features a strange mix of music and poetry, including words from a speech written in secret for the Queen for broadcast in the event of a nuclear war. But how did Amy get a copy of it, and was its secret nature the reason she was killed? Elsewhere, Miller enjoys her first romance since her divorce, while Gerry goes on his future son-in-law's stag night. Amy Nuttall (Emmerdale, Downton Abbey) and Jack Shepherd (Wycliffe) guest star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Emilia Fox joins the cast of the crime drama as Dr Nikki Alexander, who uses the team's equipment to solve an Iron Age mystery, but ends up bringing her expertise to bear on a modern murder. The case in question is the death of a jockey crushed by his mount during a race. The plot thickens when two of the horses' owners are killed in a helicopter crash and evidence emerges that both the horse and the pilot were drugged. James Wilby and Sylvestra Le Touzel guest star.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five sea-loving women from Eastbourne, Sussex, answer top 10-list questions on subjects including Downton Abbey, gin brands and languages. Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on a large arcade-style 'coin-pusher' machine. The more counters they collect, the greater the prize fund, with the last one standing competing for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as another four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but anyone caught by the Chaser is out for good, leaving fewer players to team up and play in the final chase.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates another comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers. This time around, a delivery drone drops a painful parcel, a quad-bike rolls into a lake, and a baby steals a smartphone and spends a fortune on concert tickets.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family
programme.desc: In a reality TV special, former Gogglebox star and 2016 Queen of the Jungle Scarlett Moffatt takes on 2019 Love Island contestant Curtis Pritchard. The pair - along with their families - go head to head in the knockout tournament, hoping to advance to the next round. Presented by Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show: Live
programme.desc: As life in lockdown continues, Martin Lewis has up-to-the-minute advice for these financially uncertain times. He'll be taking viewers' questions on how the ongoing crisis affects family finances, jobs and consumer rights, and offers money-saving tips and tricks.

programme.title: Unbelievable Moments Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong presents a selection of extraordinary eyewitness footage filmed by members of the public, including the dramatic story of an amateur pilot who built his own plane, but then lost his propeller mid-flight and had to try to land it without any power. A local resident in northern California tries to flee what goes down in history as the state's deadliest wildfire, and a cliff collapse at a popular tourist spot in Greece causes chaos.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: Euro 96 England v Netherlands - ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Gabriel Clarke introduces action from the memorable Group A match, which came from Wembley Stadium. Bob Wilson presented the coverage, with analysis from John Barnes and Jack Charlton, and commentary by Brian Moore and Kevin Keegan.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which five neighbours from Lancashire answer questions on subjects that include Jane Austen, food and drink and film, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: The Magic Singles of the Week
programme.desc: These are the top 20 songs we're loving right now. Stay tuned for a delicious mix of today's feel-good favourites and a huge dollop of laidback loveliness straight from the Magic HQ.

programme.title: Hits Don't Lie: Girls Rule: Top 25
programme.desc: We're keeping it current as AJ Odudu brings us the biggest bangers of The Tens, including contemporary classics from Little Mix, Ed Sheeran and Rihanna.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The manufacture of Kamaz trucks and hair-care products and the construction of Chinese landmark building the Canton Tower.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a rust-free Triumph Stag, a task that proves much more difficult than he first thought - and when he eventually finds a car for Edd China, the mechanic has to perform repairs on a tight budget to keep a profit in sight.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While free-styling in Virginia's Appalachian Mountains, 'pickers' Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz come across a hideaway filled with history - and even some mementos from a bluegrass legend.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team heads to Hunter Mountain for fun and games on the slopes, while the bike set for auction is sent to be painted and powder-coated.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Construction crews in Bethel race to complete Era's newest hangar before the winter snow arrives, but when Jim turns up to inspect their progress, he is less than impressed.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe visits Miami to recover and crush abandoned boats, before heading to San Francisco to collect and recycle used mattresses.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes involved in the making of individual transporters, post clocks and drum heads.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The science and technology behind the manufacture of air bags, jelly beans and domestic water heaters, and how these methods have evolved over time.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Agents investigating the death of a New York petrol station mogul infiltrate the crime ring responsible and discover a Mafia world of brutality and murder.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Tyre marks and fibres snare a murderer who stabbed two women, and a man stages an 'accident' to kill his wife.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When 12-year-old Alajawan Brown is shot dead outside a shop in Washington, near to an earlier shooting, police refer to CCTV to see if the two are connected. S5/14/16.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murders of Michael and Valerie Miller, shot dead in the kitchen of their Maine home in November 2009. Nathaniel Nightingale, a friend of the couple's son, claimed his gun went off by accident when he shot Michael Miller, and that he shot Valerie in panic.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A land developer's wife goes missing, and investigators soon become suspicious of an overly helpful neighbour.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Houston SPCA Investigator Barbra Christiansen responds to a call involving what sounds like a serious case of cat overcrowding - one house and 35 cats.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A mini pig who loves to dig is in trouble with local authorities, a homeless shih-tzu cross is in a critical condition, and a baby cheetah must pass a series of tests.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori tries to find a dress for a bossy bridesmaid, while Summer wants a gown that is over her budget.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A customer invites her fiance's ex-girlfriend to the salon, and while Tracy wants a short dress, her partner would prefer her to have a long gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
programme.desc: Lacey wants a dress that will show off her very large back tattoo, but her mother wants it fully covered.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three Brits go shopping in Carpentras in Provence, buying a ram's skull, a pair of car doors and an olive oil pot which they transform and try to sell for a profit in Lincoln.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: The owner of London Road Pawnbrokers in Sheffield has to deal with a bus-load of antiques and a watch once owned by Saddam Hussein. Meanwhile, 200 miles away at Pickwicks in London, Nathan and Debbs value an impressive collection of jewels and watches, a set of antique coins and a pair of luxury designer handbags.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: The investigation of an illegal cock-fighting ring reveals deliberate cruelty to the birds.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: A group of rookies learns the ropes at Pennsylvania SPCA's Humane Law Enforcement, investigating cases of animal cruelty.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How killers try to mislead detectives by making a murder look like suicide, and the role of forensics in establishing the truth.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How science is helping police establish links between contract killers and their employers.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Sherrill Levitt, Suzie Streeter and Stacy McCall who vanished from their home in Springfield, Missouri, in June 1992. Sherrill was Suzie's mother, while Stacy was her friend and the disappearance happened a day after Suzie and Stacy had graduated from high school.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of teenager Samantha Bonnell, who vanished after a row with her boyfriend at a Californian cinema in September 2005. She died in a road traffic accident later the same night, but having no identification on her lay unclaimed at the San Bernardino County Coroner's Office until the link with her missing persons case was made 19 months later.

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: Actress Tamzin Outhwaite visits the case of 19-year-old Jessie Blodgett, who was found strangled to death in her bed just hours after a returning home from a pool party.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Britanny shops with her uncle, who insists her dress has lots of sparkle, while Nicole finds her father is eager to please.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Triplet Samantha finds her opinionated sisters want to make the final dress decision, while siblings Jessica and Kristen shop together.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Rasha needs a ball gown that will wow all 700 guests at her wedding, while Melissa's father has a surprise for her.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer knows what she wants from her dress, but her bridesmaids do not like the idea and push her into trying other styles.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride's mother has firm ideas about the wedding dress, while another does not approve of her daughter's desire for a sexy look.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride wants a dress from her hometown that proves hard to obtain, while another customer takes a liking to a satin dress.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: I Want to Heal My Mother's Heart
programme.desc: A woman whose parents kicked her out after learning she was pregnant tries to find the son she hasn't seen in nearly 50 years. Hosted by Chris Jacobs and Lisa Joyner.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Part two of two. Pauline must find the will to keep up her weight-loss progress after a medical emergency. Plus, Chay's journey changes course in dramatic way.

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: Documentary examining the crimes of Charles Starkweather, an American killer who murdered 11 people in the late 1950s during a road trip with his lover.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: After a young woman was found beaten to death in Wisconsin in 1984, the killer evaded detection for decades. However, a revolutionary DNA method later revealed his identity.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A cult member betrays the leader to the FBI following the discovery of a decapitated young male, and is able to link him with dozens of other murders.
